documents.content:
# Contra Costa County Childcare Programs

## CocoKids
Primary R&R and Alternative Payment provider.

## Key Contacts
- **CocoKids**: (925) 676-5437
- **Contra Costa Employment & Human Services**: (877) 505-4630

## Programs Available
- CalWORKs Stages 1-3
- Alternative Payment Program
- State Preschool partnerships
- Head Start programs

## Geographic Coverage
- West County (Richmond, El Cerrito)
- Central County (Walnut Creek, Concord)
- East County (Antioch, Brentwood)

## Special Resources
- First 5 Contra Costa quality programs
- School district preschools
- Community college child development centers

## Wait List Information
- Varies by area within county
- Urban areas: 8-16 months typical
- Update contact info regularly

## Unique Features
- Diverse communities with varied needs
- Military family support (Mare Island nearby)
- Strong family childcare network

# Ventura County Childcare Programs

## Child Development Resources
Primary R&R for Ventura County.

## Key Contacts
- **CDR**: (805) 485-7878
- **Ventura County HSA**: (866) 846-1602

## Programs
- CalWORKs Child Care
- Alternative Payment Program
- State Preschool
- Head Start (VCCDC)

## Coverage Areas
- Ventura, Oxnard, Camarillo
- Thousand Oaks, Simi Valley
- Fillmore, Santa Paula (agricultural)

## Special Considerations
- Military families (Naval Base Ventura County)
- Agricultural worker childcare
- Coastal and inland variation in availability

## Resources
- First 5 Ventura County
- Ventura County Community College child development
- School district programs

## Migrant Programs
Agricultural areas have:
- Migrant Head Start
- Migrant Alternative Payment
- Bilingual services

## Wait Times
- Coastal areas: 6-12 months
- Inland areas: May vary

# San Mateo County Childcare Programs

## 4Cs of San Mateo County
Primary R&R and AP provider.

## Key Contacts
- **4Cs San Mateo**: (650) 517-1460
- **San Mateo County HSA**: (800) 223-8383

## High Cost Area
San Mateo is one of California's most expensive areas for childcare.

### Typical Monthly Costs
- Infant: $2,800-4,000
- Toddler: $2,200-3,200
- Preschool: $1,800-2,800

## Programs Available
- CalWORKs Stages 1-3
- Alternative Payment Program
- Big Lift (local preschool initiative)
- Head Start

## Big Lift Initiative
- County investment in preschool
- Free high-quality preschool
- Multiple locations
- Income eligibility varies

## Special Resources
- Tech company childcare benefits
- Stanford University programs nearby
- Strong family childcare network

## Wait List
Longer waits due to:
- High demand
- High costs limit provider availability
- Expect 12-24 months

# Kern County Childcare Programs

## Community Connection for Child Care
Primary R&R for Kern County.

## Key Contacts
- **CCCC**: (661) 861-5200
- **Kern County DHS**: (800) 560-1515

## Programs
- CalWORKs Child Care
- Alternative Payment
- State Preschool
- Head Start (CAP-K)
- Migrant Head Start

## Geographic Considerations
- Bakersfield metro area
- Agricultural communities
- Remote areas (Tehachapi, Ridgecrest)
- Diverse needs across county

## Agricultural Focus
- Large migrant worker population
- Seasonal childcare needs
- Bilingual services essential
- Flexible scheduling

## Military Presence
- Edwards Air Force Base
- China Lake Naval Weapons Center
- Military family programs

## Resources
- First 5 Kern
- Kern Community College District
- CAP-K Head Start

## Wait Times
- Urban Bakersfield: 6-12 months
- Rural areas: Variable, some availability

# San Joaquin County Childcare Programs

## San Joaquin County Office of Education - Choices
Primary childcare program administrator.

## Key Contacts
- **Choices Program**: (209) 468-9090
- **San Joaquin HSA**: (888) 600-2271

## Programs Available
- CalWORKs Stages 1-3
- Alternative Payment Program
- State Preschool
- Head Start

## Coverage Areas
- Stockton
- Tracy, Manteca
- Lodi
- Rural communities

## Unique Characteristics
- Growing commuter population (Bay Area commuters)
- Agricultural communities
- Diverse population
- Affordable compared to Bay Area

## Child Care Shortage
Rapid population growth has created:
- Provider shortages in some areas
- Wait lists for quality programs
- Need for more infant care

## Resources
- First 5 San Joaquin
- San Joaquin Delta College child development
- Community Action Agency

## Tips for Families
- Apply early
- Consider Tracy/Manteca for Bay Area commuters
- Rural areas may have availability

# Sonoma County Childcare Programs

## 4Cs of Sonoma County
Primary R&R and AP provider.

## Key Contacts
- **4Cs Sonoma**: (707) 544-3077
- **Sonoma County Human Services**: (877) 699-6868

## Programs
- CalWORKs Child Care
- Alternative Payment Program
- State Preschool
- Head Start

## Geographic Coverage
- Santa Rosa metro
- Petaluma
- Healdsburg, Windsor
- Sonoma Valley
- Coastal (Bodega Bay area)

## Disaster Recovery
Post-wildfire considerations:
- Some programs relocated
- Increased need after fires
- Emergency childcare resources
- Trauma-informed care emphasis

## Wine Country Economy
- Tourism/hospitality worker childcare needs
- Agricultural (viticulture) seasonal needs
- Non-traditional hours common

## Resources
- First 5 Sonoma
- Santa Rosa Junior College child development
- Quality Counts Sonoma (QRIS)

## Wait Times
- Varies significantly by area
- Santa Rosa: 8-16 months
- Rural: May have some availability

# Monterey County Childcare Programs

## United Way Monterey County
Manages childcare resource and referral.

## Key Contacts
- **United Way Childcare Resources**: (831) 757-5137
- **Monterey County DSS**: (888) 809-8086

## Programs
- CalWORKs Child Care
- Alternative Payment Program
- State Preschool
- Head Start
- Migrant Head Start (significant)

## Agricultural Community
Monterey County has one of California's largest agricultural economies.

### Migrant Programs
- Migrant Head Start centers
- Migrant Alternative Payment
- Seasonal flexibility
- Bilingual staff

## Geographic Areas
- Salinas (largest city)
- Monterey Peninsula
- South County agricultural
- Big Sur coast (limited)

## Special Considerations
- Migrant worker family services prominent
- Multiple language needs
- Tourism economy on Peninsula
- Agricultural schedule flexibility

## Resources
- First 5 Monterey
- Hartnell College child development
- CSUMB programs

## Wait Times
- Salinas: 6-12 months
- Peninsula: 12-18 months (higher cost area)

# Tulare County Childcare Programs

## Tulare County Office of Education - First 5
Coordinates early childhood programs.

## Key Contacts
- **TCOE Early Childhood**: (559) 651-0677
- **Tulare County HHSA**: (559) 713-5000

## Programs
- CalWORKs Child Care
- Alternative Payment Program
- State Preschool
- Head Start (CSET)
- Migrant Head Start

## Agricultural Focus
Tulare County is California's top agricultural producer.

### Worker Support
- Extensive migrant programs
- Seasonal schedule accommodation
- Multiple language services
- Rural outreach

## Geographic Coverage
- Visalia (county seat)
- Tulare, Porterville
- Lindsay, Dinuba
- Small agricultural communities

## Challenges
- Large rural area
- Transportation barriers
- Provider shortages in some areas
- Poverty rates above state average

## Resources
- First 5 Tulare
- College of the Sequoias child development
- Community Services Employment Training (CSET)

## Wait Times
- Generally shorter than urban areas
- Some programs have availability
- Migrant programs well-established

# Placer County Childcare Programs

## KidZCommunity (Child Action)
Serves Placer County R&R needs.

## Key Contacts
- **KidZCommunity**: (530) 889-2999
- **Placer County HHS**: (888) 886-5401

## Programs
- CalWORKs Child Care
- Alternative Payment Program
- State Preschool
- Head Start

## Geographic Coverage
- Roseville, Rocklin (growing suburban)
- Auburn, Colfax (Sierra foothills)
- Lincoln, Loomis
- Tahoe area (seasonal)

## Growing Region
Placer County is one of California's fastest growing:
- Childcare demand increasing
- New providers emerging
- Infrastructure developing

## Resort Area Considerations
Tahoe region:
- Seasonal employment childcare needs
- Tourism worker schedules
- Limited year-round options
- Higher costs in resort areas

## Resources
- First 5 Placer
- Sierra College child development
- Placer County Office of Education

## Wait Times
- Roseville area: 8-16 months
- Auburn: 4-10 months
- Tahoe: Variable, seasonal

# Santa Barbara County Childcare Programs

## Children's Resource & Referral
Primary R&R for Santa Barbara County.

## Key Contacts
- **CR&R**: (805) 962-8988
- **Santa Barbara County DSS**: (805) 681-4401

## Programs
- CalWORKs Child Care
- Alternative Payment Program
- State Preschool
- Head Start
- Migrant programs

## Geographic Areas
- Santa Barbara city (high cost)
- Goleta, Carpinteria
- Santa Maria (north county)
- Lompoc, Solvang

## Dual Economy

### South County (Santa Barbara)
- High cost of living
- University community (UCSB)
- Tourism workers
- High childcare costs

### North County (Santa Maria)
- Agricultural economy
- Migrant worker services
- More affordable
- Different provider landscape

## Resources
- First 5 Santa Barbara
- SBCC and Hancock College child development
- Family Service Agency

## Wait Times
- South County: 12-24 months
- North County: 6-12 months
